Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Pocket Yama’ offers the quintessential sweet potato flavour: a rich, honeyed sweetness with moist, vibrant orange flesh that becomes creamy when cooked. The tubers are small, elongated, and typically 8-12 cm long, with smooth, copper-red skin. The plant itself is a semi-trailing beauty with heart-shaped, purple-tinged leaves that serve as an ornamental ground cover and a source of edible, nutrient-rich greens.

2. The Personal-Sized Sweet Treasure This sweet potato’s perfect individual size and classic flavour make it incredibly versatile.

  • Whole-Roasted Perfection: Its small size allows it to roast quickly and evenly, becoming caramelized and tender, perfect as a single-serving side dish.
  • Steamed or Boiled: Ideal for steaming or boiling whole, then mashed or simply split open with a pat of butter.
  • Sweet Potato Fries: Can be sliced into uniform wedges or rounds for baking into perfect, personal batches of sweet potato fries or chips.
  • Greens Sauté: The young leaves and shoots are a delicious, nutritious green when sautéed with garlic, similar to spinach but with a heartier texture.

3. The Harvest and Yield ‘Pocket Yama’ is a mid-season producer that signals harvest time when the vines begin to yellow slightly in the autumn. The compact root system allows the entire plant to be lifted easily from a container. Supplied as an RFID-tagged slip, a single plant provides a modest but valuable yield of 4-6 small, uniformly-sized tubers, with a total weight of 400-600 grams, ready for harvest approximately 100-110 days after planting.
